So if you run 'git change' from branch foo without any staged changes, it
won't create the change either?

On 13 December 2014 at 03:50, Russ Cox <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Actually, I sent you a CL that makes 'git change foo' without the git add
> just switch to foo and not make you type a commit message. That seems even
> nicer. It might still be worth putting the check in git mail, but the point
> is that we can make the workflow better and make this a non-problem for
> most people.
